title: Mongol Money and Genoese Bank Images MCQ 1

content.description:
Image 1

WOOD PRINTING PLATE CONTAINING A PAPER MONEY NOTE WRITTEN IN MONGOL AND CHINESE, PRODUCED IN CHINA, CIRCA 1287

Pictures from History/Bridgeman Images

The smaller Chinese characters on the lower half of the note say, “This note can be circulated in various provinces without expiration dates. Counterfeiters will be put to death.”

Image 2

“MONEYLENDING AT INTEREST IN A BANKING HOUSE,” THE TREATISE ON THE SEVEN SINS, MANUSCRIPT PRODUCED IN GENOA, NORTHERN ITALY, EARLY FOURTEENTH CENTURY

Heritage Image Partnership Ltd / Alamy Stock Photo

The Latin text in the upper left-hand corner warns against greed.
content.question: The commercial practices shown in the images emerged in order to

choices.label: facilitate the development of regional trade networks by creating uniform currencies and systems of credit.
finance imperial conquests by supplying credit and currency for purchasing weapons.
facilitate a growing trade in luxury goods by providing greater access to credit and currency.
finance transnational Chinese artisan businesses across Eurasia by diversifying sources of credit and currency.

content.answer: facilitate a growing trade in luxury goods by providing greater access to credit and currency.
